commit.title: Refactor `SummerBuilder` to make it possible to use `Counters` on `SummerBuilder` creation (#738)
Introduce ability to use grouping for `leftJoin` (#737)
Introduce new type of tuples we send over the network in Storm platform and fix issues with current topology builder  (#734)
Fix the bug with reducer estimators not working (#714)
Clean up all but the transient warnings (#708)
Make sure the tail in TPNamedProducer actually names a tail (#706)
Track state in summingbird-online as an Iterator rather than a Seq. (#703)
Support settings for enabling early compaction for async cache. (#702)
Aggregate message IDs with values in AggregatorOutputCollector (#693)
Scalding Platform honors configProvider in buildConfig (#696)
Pass the semigroup to create Mergeable online (#687)
Extracting Future queuing logic from AsyncBase (#685)
Add Sam Ritchie as a COMMITTER
Adding crush down capability into the SourceNode (#682)
Add doc comments for Dag and minor reformatting.
Issue #675.Configurable elimination of FlatMapNode by enhancing Sourcâ¦ (#676)
Add some Execution support in scalding (#674)

Remove space in import, running tests adds them back.

Remove watermark logic, benchmark didn't show that it made any difference.
Optimize clearing futures and clear up a little more futures than needed so that we don't hit the limit soon.
Remove extra spaces in import braces.
Fix condition in AsyncBase and add test.

Make LTuple2's hash code not be lazy, we always use it

Since we are calling hash code on primitives in the BatchID and Timestamp classes here we should just proxy them through. Calling hashcode on an Int/Long is extremely cheap (its the identity function).
Remove private restriction and add ac moment on the LTuple2
Fix hash code generation -- cannot use super in a case class
Use ordered serialization where we control the key passed in thats just a Timestamp or BatchID in groupings
Do not use set references to more closely match our other Kryo usages
Make the BatchID a case class so we can use it with ordered serializations
Use LTuple2 which uses a lazy hash code to avoid repeated hashcode calculations for a type that ends up in a map
